column1: As a developer I want to show dates in server time and not local laptop time As a developer, I want Compass to show date values in server time and not converted to the local laptop time so that I confirm that my application is saving dates correctly.

As an Ops team member I want to script installs of Compass As an Ops team member I want to script installs of Compass across many machines so I can deploy Compass on laptops of new employees install widely across my organization .
As a Windows user I want to specify Compass s installation directory As a Compass user I want to install Compass in a certain directory so that I abide by my organisation s security policy.

As a product manager I want to survey users for NPS as they use the app As a product manager I want to survey users for NPS as they use the app so that I can maximise the response rate and not distract the user from their current context using Compass .

As a developer I want to use elemMatch Hi, I m trying to use the following projection This works in the shell, but not in Compass. The UI element doesn t validate this projection statement stays red . Is this by design?

As a user I want to opt in to using 3rd party plugins As a user I want to opt in to the use of 3rd party plugins so that I am awareness and consenting when I install a 3rd party plugin from other vendors and so I can be sure that the default Compass plugins are secure and provided by MongoDB.

As a user I want to be informed about what plugins are trying to do As a user I want to be informed about what plugins are trying to do and either authorize or deny those actions, in order to control the security of my Compass instance.

As a user I want Compass to log 3rd party plugin actions audit trail As a user, I want Compass to log 3rd party plugin plugin actions that may be a risk to security, in order to audit what plugins are doing and potentially disable them.
As a developer I want to understand what each pipeline operator does As a developer I want to understand what each pipeline operator does so I don t have to google for an explanation.

As a user I want to refresh my documents list from the keyboard As a user I want to refresh my documents list from the keyboard so that I can Stick to a workflow I am familiar with Be more agile at the keyboard Not have to use my mouse
As a user I want to execute a query without leaving my keyboard As a user I want to execute a query without leaving my keyboard so I can be more agile and not have to use the mouse.

As a user I want to quickly and easily see all the Compass windows I have open As a user I want to quickly and easily see all the Compass windows I have open so I can switch to the other collection I am working on.
As a brand new user I would like to get started with an Atlas instance as quickly as possible As a brand new user I would like to get started with an Atlas instance as quickly as possible.
User Provided DNS Whitelisting As a user I want to provide dns entries to whitelist in the Compass Content Security Policy, so I may access data from locations not currently allowed in Compass.
As a new user I want a quick way to seed a new mongodb database As a new user I want a quick way to seed a new mongodb database so I can play around with test data.
As a user I want to use a scroll bar to scroll the license agreement As a user I want to use a scroll bar to scroll the license agreement so I can click the Agree button.

As a user I want to be able to write a note or description on a field name in the schema view As a user I want to be able to write a note or description on a field name in the schema view so I can quickly understand and reference what it means later on.
As a developer I want to insert a new document as JSON As a developer I want to insert a new document as JSON.

As a user I would like visual feedback when executing queries As a user I would like visual feedback when executing queries so that I can tell that the operation was sent to the server and is currently in progress remove uncertainty . From Joe In Compass all versions up to 1.10.1.0 long running queries give no feedback when running or when completed. As a result you have to spot the number of results changing to determine if a query is complete. I have attached a screen capture demonstrating this. Sorry about the background noise on the video. I was in an airport lounge

As a developer I want to copy a document to clipboard as json As a developer I want to copy a document to clipboard as json so I can share the document with other members on my team and or compare it with the output from my application.

As an SA I would like to remove individual entries from my recent connections list As an SA I would like to remove individual entries from my recent connections list so that I can remove previous customer hostnames when demoing at other customers.

As a user with large documents I want to provide a filter or project before the documents view populates As a user with large documents I want to provide a filter or project before the documents view populates for speed and performance.

As a user with large documents I would like to have my documents collapsed to their ObjectID s by default As a user with large documents I would like to have my documents collapsed to their ObjectID s by default and then click to expand to see the whole document so that I can make the most of my screen real estate.
As a user I would like to see the time it took to execute a query when the documents view loads As a user I would like to see the time it took to execute a query when the documents view loads.
As a user I am confused between the history icon and the refresh icon As a user I am confused between the history icon and the refresh icon and I keep clicking history thinking its refresh.
As a user I find the arrow in the json editor too small to click As a user I find the arrow in the json editor too small to click, please make it bigger.

As a user I am confused between when the reset button takes the place of the Analyze button As a user I am confused between when the reset button takes the place of the Analyze button and I find myself hitting refresh by mistake when I really want to analyze.
As an ops person I want to see chunk distribution of a sharded cluster
As a user I want to see my collection header update when I click refresh so that I can correlate the number of new documents in a collection with the document refresh button avoid confusion

As a user I want to view the EULA in Compass Community so that I can prove to my organization that I m using free software Product acceptance criteria Create a new menu item in Compass Community only Menu item should be in Help Menu View License Agreement Clicking the link loads an external browser and takes you to the website with the license agreement link to be provided .

As a user I want to persist favorites and recent connections to somewhere other than local storage The customer indicates that they can create connections fine and also save these as favorites. When they restart Compass they can see both their recent connections and saved favourites in the left hand panel as expected. However, when they log out of their Windows server and back in again their favorites and recent connections do not persist. I understand that these are saved in and they are not stored as file on disk at present.
As a user I am confused if I can enter multiple replica members in the connect window
As a developer I want to export my query to Java syntax
As a developer I want to export my query to Node.js syntax
As a developer I want to export my query to Python
Upgrade to React 16.3.2 Let s get on the latest version of React 16.3.2
As a user I want to write and enforce JSON Schema on my documents

As a product manager I want telemetry in the agg pipeline builder As a product manager I want telemetry in the agg pipeline builder so I can see how our customers use the interface. Interesting questions to ask How long was spent building the pipeline? How many stages was the pipeline? What are the most frequently used stages? What are some common mistakes made? What is the size of the sample set by users? How often does someone get stuck writing a pipeline fail to create a valid pipeline?
As a mac user I want to install the latest copy of Compass with Homebrew
As a user who has logged in via kerberos, I want Compass to be a fully a kerberized application Use the logged in user context rather than prompt the user to reenter their un pwd.
As a product manager I would like to funnel more people to our Atlas business Scope A simple link to Sign up for an Atlas cluster in the UI.
As a developer I want to export my query to .NET

Community Remove ability to toggle usage stats and auto updates on off There appears to be a regression in CC 1.11.2 the privacy settings are visable, toggleable and can be accessed from the Help Privacy menu. Updated description We want to force users to provide usage stats and force them to have auto updates so they are always running the latest version. Let s remove those options from the privacy menu.
As a user I would like to duplicate a favorite As a user I would like to duplicate a favorite so that it is quicker for me to use existing information as a starting point when creating a new favorite

As a French speaking Compass user I would prefer the user interface to use French instead of English Providing a version of Compass with the user interface translated to French would improve the user experience for corresponding users.
As a user I want support for binary subtype UUID
As A New User I Want To Generate Sample Data From A JSON Schema As a new user, I want to generate sample data from a JSON schema, in order to start using my database.

As A New User I Want To Generate Sample Data Using A GUI As a new user, I want to generate sample data using a GUI instead of editing a JSON Schema document, in order to start using my currently empty database.
As a user I want to create a new JSON schema for my empty collection
As a user I want to create a new GUI schema for my empty collection
As a user I want to perform field level actions on my created GUI schema
As a user I want my created GUI schema and or my created JSON schema to stay in sync
As a user I want to see 1 sample document preview as I edit my JSON GUI schema
As a user I want to save my created schema to Compass
As a user I want to see a list of all my saved schemas
As a user I want to export my created schema to file system as JSON schema document
As a user I want to copy my created schema to my clipboard as a JSON document
As a user I want to delete my saved schema from Compass
As a user I want to edit my schema s metadata as saved in Compass
As a user I want duplicate my schema saved in Compass
As a user I want to import a JSON schema from my file system
As a user I want to import a JSON schema from MongoDB Docs bundled within Compass
As a user I want to specify the number of documents to generate from my created schema
As a user I want to export my constructed FIND expression from the querybar on the documents view
As a user I want to export my constructed FIND expression from the querybar on the schema view
As a user I see a warning info banner explaining why my constructed PROJECT, SORT, SKIP, LIMIT options are not included as part of the exported query
As a user I want to export the stages from my constructed aggregation pipeline on the aggregation view
As a user I see a warning info banner explaining why my constructed query includes only my aggregation stages and not the additional aggregation syntax in my driver
As a user I want to export my extended JSON query from Compass into MongoDB Shell syntax
As a user I want to export my extended JSON query from Compass into Python syntax
As a user I want to export my extended JSON query from Compass into Java syntax
As a user I want to export my extended JSON query from Compass into C syntax
As a user I want to see the current driver version alongside the constructed query in the language targeted for export
As a user I want to see the current language version for the constructed query in the language targeted for export
As a user I want to see my extended JSON query alongside the constructed query in the language targeted for export
As a user I want to copy the constructed query in the language targeted for export to my clipboard

As an enterprise Compass user in a regulated industry, I need to use Compass without any outbound connections to MongoDB or third parties Enterprise customers have requested a version of Compass that does not open any outbound connections under any conditions. This build of Compass would not connect to Stitch, Intercom, Bugsnag, Deis, or the map visualization provider.
As a Compass user I want to install Compass Community via brew cask As a Compass user I want to install Compass Community via brew cask, like so
As a Compass user, I need the chat button to not obscure the Update , Delete buttons required for CRUD operations See comments

Don t Specify Read Preference on Connection This is a placeholder story to potentially flush out not specifying the read preference on the connection window, but allowing the user to change it once connected to the instance. Requested by Norberto.

As a user I would like to persist favorites after upgrade As a Compass user I would like to persist my list of favorites after a Compass version upgrade so that it is quicker for me to access hosts that I have saved before After trying to upgrade from 1.11 til 12.2, and afterwards to 1.33.0 beta 7, it seems this feature is not in the product. My favorites turn out blank after upgrade.
Export and import favorite list As a Compass user I would like to export and import my favorite list so that other users may access the same hosts without having to type anything
Explicitly indicate a view As a Compass user I want to distinguish views from collections So that I easily understand what I am selecting in the sidebar or in the list of collections
Rename collection As a Compass user, I want to rename a collection.

As a new Compass Atlas user but long time IT specialist, I need the ability to troubleshoot connection problems in complex networking environments. There are at least six different user actions that can lead to . Some other error messages are less overloaded, but possibly confusing in the absence of understanding the underlying exception that caused them.

URI encoding required for password with special characters? According to Compass requires URI encoded special characters in database user passwords when connecting. Is this really true? if so, is there a way for us to not require this when connecting in Compass? In parallel I'd like to get Atlas to warn around encoding requirements in the URI in a UI validating when users use a special char
Make connection error messaging more helpful Getting read ECONNRESET error message is not very helpful. It would be much better to indicate Enable SSL .

Agg pipeline builder to autocompolete newly defined fields Currently, the Agg Pipeline builder offers field autocompletion based on the collection selected for aggregation. I'd like to see this extended to the new fields defined in the project stages that precede any new stages that attempts to use them. See example attached.

Agg Pipeline Builder Create an icon to create insert a new stage inplace Add a plus button next to the Delete button for each stage. When clicked, it inserts a new stage right after the one that is currently selected. This will help avoid a lot of vertical scrolling and also unnecessary movement dragging of stages when you want to simply insert a stage in the middle of a pipeline, which is very common when agg pipelines.
As a Compass user, I would like the zero state experience to be similar to the experiences in other MongoDB Products.

As a user, the disappearance of the field name when editing long strings is disorienting When a user clicks on a very long string in the Compass document editor, the input widget is expanded and hides the field name of that string.

Use Cmd F to find field name to check value Feature request As a user who has documents with a large ish 100 number of keys, I want to be able to cmd F to search for the key Im looking for to check its value without having to scroll through reading over each key.

Support Collation in Agg Pipeline Builder Add collation support to the aggregation pipeline builder. Add the collation field. Pass collation options when executing the stages. Pass collation options when executing a out
As a user, I would like to use collations when I filter collections There does not appear to currently be the capability to all a collation to the document filtering of the Documents tab.

For a developer, aggregation pipeline error messages from the server could be more intuitive The attached error message is not intuitive. The error occurs because the server is version 3.6 and not 4.0 and the agg operator was introduced in 4.0. However, the error message seems to suggest that a parsing error occurred in Compass. One way to improve these error messages would be to prepend a reference to the database server for those errors originating from the server.
As a user, I would like an improved data import export experience.

As a user, I would like an improved experience when pasting pre existing Aggregation Pipelines. Let s try if no stage selected and you paste into stage editor, the pipeline fills out. If messy, we ll re eval

As a Compass user without npm experience, I would like to build plugins using the tutorials in the documentation. Following the Database User View Tutorial I am not able to execute the step. This appears to be associated with a change in the packages needed and or referenced. The template files generated by Khaos do not match the general structure of the ones listed in the tutorial.
Schema Validation Component As a Compass user I want to see, create and modify schema validation rules for my collections so that I can guarantee that my data will always be in the shape I expect

Smart Rule Editor As a Compass user I want some help when writing my validation rules So that I don t need to remember the syntax of the validation operators, properties and their allowed values and the name of the fields of existing documents
validationlevel And validationaction Support As a Compass user I want to control validationLevel and validationAction for my validation rules So that I can configure validation according to my needs

Preview As a Compass user I want to see if existing documents match or do not match the validation rules I am adding So that I can understand whether I am adding the right rules and whether my existing data would need some cleanup
Connect Screen Improvements As a Compass user I want a simple connect experience So that I better understand what information I need to fill in for my connection.
Compass Connect Documentation As a Compass user I want information on how to connect to So that if I have difficulties with connecting to my database I can do a search and find what I need.
Clone favorites As a Compass user I want to be able to clone favorite connections So that I quickly create favorites for all my different environments.
Tabbed view As a Compass user I want to be able to open collections in different tabs So that I have a quick way to switch from one collection from another, from one task to another
Tooltips As a Compass user I want to understand what the different UI controls do So that I know what is going to happen when I click on them.
Agg. Pipeline settings As a Compass user I want to set sample size, number of docs in preview and maxTimeMS So that I have better control over how Compass is executing and displaying my pipeline.

Export to language discoverability As a Compass user I want a quick and discoverable access to export to language So that I can easily find it and I can take advantage of it to speed up my application development.
Links to stage examples As a Compass user I want to access examples for each stage So that I can immediately understand how to use the stage and its parameters.

Full screen stage editor As a Compass user I want more real estate for my stage editor So that I can see everything I type into the editor without a lot of scrolling, even when my stage contains a lot of code.
Pipeline overview As a Compass user I want to see my entire pipeline at once So that I can quickly see what it is doing.

Create a View from an aggregation pipeline As a Compass user I want to create a View from an aggregation pipeline So that I can make sure my data is in the right shape to be used in my application or to create a chart from it.

Using a View As a Compass user I want to see the details of a View when I select it So that I can easily understand that it is a View and I can see what collection it is based on see the documents that are in the View and run queries and aggregations on top of it

Modify a View As a Compass user I want to edit a View as in edit the aggregation pipeline behind the View So that I can go and adjust the details if the documents I am seeing are not in the shape I expected them to be
Duplicate a View As a Compass user I want to duplicate an existing View So that I don t need to start from scratch when I want to create a new, similar one

Display of encrypted fields As a Compass user I want to know what fields are encrypted with FLE So that I understand why I can t see the content of the field and I know I should not attempt to modify the content of the field
JSON Mode for Compass As a Compass user I want to see and edit documents in extended JSON So that I have a way to work in an environment that is similar to my code editor where I feel productive
Create a single document in JSON mode As a Compass user I want to create a new document in extend JSON So that I can easily copy paste from my code editor or from an API response
Create multiple documents at once in JSON mode As a Compass user I want to create multiple documents in extend JSON So that I can easily copy paste from my code editor or from an API response
Export CSV As a Compass user I want to export documents to a CSV file So that I can use them with tools outside the MongoDB ecosystem
Import CSV select fields As a Compass user I want to specify the fields I want to import from CSV So that I can control what data I want to have in my collection and specify the schema
Import CSV As a Compass user I want to import documents from a CSV file So that I can quickly seed my collection with existing data that may come from non MongoDB tools
Export JSON As a Compass user I want to export documents as a JSON So that I use my data with other tools
Import JSON As a Compass user I want to import documents from a JSON file So that I can quickly seed my collection with existing data
Import Export entry points As a Compass user I want to contextual entry points to import export So that I can find and access the functionality where I needed

Select fields when exporting a collection As a Compass user I want to select the fields that will be written into the exported JSON or CSV file So that I only export what is needed and I can keep the file small
Select fields when exporting CSV
Import CSV select types As a Compass user I want to specify types for the fields I want to import from CSV So that I can control the schema of data I want to have in my collection

Import refresh documents view when an import completes As a Compass user I want the documents view to refresh when an import completes So that I can immediately interact with the new data imported into my collection and I am reassured that the import actually happened
Import update buttons when an import completes As a Compass user I want the buttons to update when an import completes So that I don t accidentally import duplicate data into my collection
